p:
The D values for the 12 CoV particles of different shapes and spike distributions lie in the range 1.31–1.58 (2nd row, Fig. 2a, Fig. 2b, Fig. 2c). The corresponding power spectra show linear decay in log–log domain at low wavelengths over a maximum of one order of magnitude (
∼
1–10 units of wavelength) (3rd row, Fig. 1). The D values for the 43 nCoV particles analyzed of different shapes lie in the range 1.34–1.85. The D estimates obtained are subjected to the ANOVA tests for statistical significance of the results, described as follows.
